data.text: Long-Distance Cyclist: Do You Use Nutritional Supplements?
Hello, how all long cycling people help their bodies with vitamins and minerals.. Thank you
Eat lots of bananas
data.author: Detlev Swoboda

data.text: Eat dates too
data.author: Sunil Kolambkar

data.text: I find beer the most beautiful panacea
data.author: Graeme Maher

data.text: we eat bananas, drink beer and wine but also take a multi vit, same as when we are mountain trekking.
data.author: Ian Barker

data.text: Make sure that I have a varied diet. Exploring the local cuisine is one of the best things you can do when you travel. And cycling gives you a good natural appetite.
data.author: Claus Andersen

data.text: I take Holland and Barrett Mega multi vits (one of the few multi vitamins with decent amounts in)
data.author: Mike Pollard

data.text: Take a multivitamin? Or just eat a good variety of foods. How low of a budget are you trying to travel on?
data.author: Jacob Ashton

data.text: low as possible...
data.author: Yavor Zheliazkov

data.text: I've found a 1 year supply of multivitamins for about $10 USD. Something like that is probably your best option. Good luck!
data.author: Jacob Ashton

data.text: Tank you
data.author: Yavor Zheliazkov

data.text: Generally you can provide all the nourishment needed with a balanced diet including fresh fruit vegetables and a source of fats from nuts and milk - there should be no need for supplements- if you are riding in hot areas then salt replacement needs to be addressed but again this does not need supplements - red wine and high cocoa solids chocolate will definitely help üôÉ
data.author: Geoff Armstrong

data.text: Never take vitamins nor minerals, except for magnesium to prevent cramps (in the toes, at night; nothing to do with cycling).
data.author: Il Padrone

data.text: So where did you get your medical degree? If you don't have one, don't give advice about vitamins or minerals.
data.author: Ray Carty

data.text: ü§£ Only getting by in life and cycling for nearly five decades.
data.author: Il Padrone

data.text: dumbest comment of the day, congratulations
data.author: Brian Beagle

data.text: Brian, with an IQ slightly less than your shoe size you clearly are the product of a consanguineous marriage.
data.author: Ray Carty

data.text: Eat fruit and vegetables. üëç
data.author: Tom Hughes

data.text: With a normal nutritional base, no need for supplements. Especially on cycling trips conditions, ~1/2 of my nutrition is oat flakes + carob flour + linseed + various nuts, amazing energy to keep power the whole day.
data.author: John Gero
